info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia SC
info.description:
At 259 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over South Congaree, or near Oak Grove, moving east at 10 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and ponding in low lying areas.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Forest Acres, Oak Grove, Red Bank, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Gaston, Hopkins, Riverbanks Zoo, SC State Farmer's Market, Columbia Metro Airport, SC State Fair Grounds, West Columbia Riverwalk, Sandy Run, Five Points, Cayce Riverwalk, and Guignard Park.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 2 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 57 and 62. Interstate 26 between mile markers 109 and 126. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 11.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
